conclusion: Introduction to the problem with a semi-circular wire frame in a magnetic field.
Recalling the formula for Ampere force.
Description of the wire frame parts: straight and semi-circular.
Plan to find total force by adding forces on straight and curved parts.
Straight part length is the diameter, \(2r\).
Assumption of current \(I\) flowing through the wire.
Magnetic field \(B\) is perpendicular to the plane.
Force on straight part is \(I \times 2r \times B\).
Same current \(I\) flows through the arc.
Magnetic field \(B\) is uniform and perpendicular.
Consider force on curved wire using effective length as chord length \(2r\).
Direction of forces: straight part force is perpendicular; curved part force integrates to center.
Consider using \(I \times A \times B\) for force on current loop.
